Join the Green Century Team

Green Century is the first family of fossil fuel free mutual funds in the U.S. that are environmentally friendly and diversified.

We offer shareholder advocacy internships to talented and motivated individuals each semester and over the summer.

For more than 30 years, Green Century has been the standard bearer of ethical investing, and because of our unique ownership by non-profits, no other fund can match our environmental and public health impact.

Green Century uses a unique three-pronged approach:

Green Century:

  1. Invests in sustainable companies: Instead of investing in environmentally harmful companies, the Green Century Funds selects companies that meet our high environmental, social and governance performance criteria.
  2. Leads an effective shareholder advocacy program: Our team of shareholder advocates directly presses nearly 100 companies every year to improve their corporate sustainability practices.
  3. Supports environmental and public health nonprofit organizations: Green Century is the only mutual fund company in the U.S. wholly owned by environmental and public health nonprofit organizations, and 100% of the profits we earn managing the Green Century Funds can be used to support their critical work.

Job Description:

Working closely with Green Century’s marketing staff, the intern(s) will be responsible for promoting Green Century’s Funds through the website,  digital marketing and design materials. This experience will offer the intern(s) the opportunity to learn about marketing investment products in the socially responsible investing space as well as web and digital marketing. We will provide training on marketing strategy, media tracking and follow-up, social media work, basics of the mutual fund industry, and web content. The intern(s) will also be exposed to the burgeoning field of environmentally and socially responsible investing.

Specific responsibilities of the advocacy internship position may include, but are not limited to:

  •  Updating and creating new website pages
  •  Grow and update the media database
  •  Draft content for press releases and website pages
  •  Find and evaluate photos and images for use in marketing materials
  •  Prepare PowerPoint presentations
  •  Assist in outreach around new tools, press releases, webinars, etc.
  •  Work with social media to enhance Green Century’s role and recognition
  •  Assist shareholder advocacy staff in preparing for corporate environmental campaigns

Qualifications:

  • A demonstrated commitment to environmental issues, and an interest in environmentally responsible business practices
  • Excellent writing skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Marketing, messaging, writing or communications experience
  • An ability to work both as part of a team as well as deliver independent projects

Hours:

The internship position will require 20 hours per week in the spring and fall, and 40 hours per week in the summer. Office hours are 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. Intern(s) must complete work within that time frame and on a regular schedule. During the fall and spring semesters, work days are flexible to accommodate student schedules and program needs.

Compensation

Green Century collaborates with the Massachusetts Clean Energy Center (MassCEC) Internship Program which requires that intern applicants either live in Massachusetts or go to undergraduate or graduate school in Massachusetts. Intern candidates should seek more details at the MassCEC internship website about whether they qualify .Information about compensation is located on the MassCEC website.

To Apply

Send a cover letter, résumé, and work or writing sample to info@greencentury.com. Specify the position and time frame in the subject line.

Green Century Capital Management is an equal opportunity employer.
